inclusion.criterion: History of locally advanced or metastatic breast cancer that is ERalpha negative or low (< 10% nuclear staining) and HER2 negative.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: =< 2 prior chemotherapy regimens for treatment of metastatic breast cancer.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status 0 or 1
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Willing to submit a biopsy specimen from locally recurrent or metastatic site (or primary if metastatic site not available) of breast cancer for ERbeta staining to Mayo Clinic Anatomic Pathology.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Presence of moderate or strong nuclear ERbeta staining in > 25% of cells in specimen submitted during Pre-Screening Step.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Measurable or non-measurable disease as defined by Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: If history of brain metastases must meet the following criteria: Patients with a history of brain metastases are eligible only if they are asymptomatic and have stable disease for >= 3 months, including < 28 days of prior to pre-registration.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Not receiving steroids for brain metastases.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Prior treatment with paclitaxel and anthracycline (in combination or in separate regimens) either in the adjuvant or metastatic setting,
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: =< 2 prior chemotherapy regimens for treatment of metastatic breast cancer. (Note: Prior use of monoclonal antibodies targeting PD1, PDL1 is allowed.)
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Uncontrolled intercurrent illness including, but not limited to: Ongoing or active infection.
exclusion.label: triggers
